properties.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 29 at 2:26AM MST until February 29 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 6 PM TODAY FOR THE
NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS..LOW
HUMIDITIES AND A DRY UNSTABLE AIRMASS...

.Gusty southwest to west winds, low humidities, much warmer than
normal temperatures as well as a dry unstable airmass will combine
to produce critical fire weather conditions over the Northeast
and East Central Plains this afternoon.

The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag
Warning...which is in effect from noon today to 6 PM MST this
evening.

* AREA AND TIMING...Northeast and East Central Plains from midday
to near sunset this evening. This includes the Interstate 40
corridor from the Santa Rosa area to the Texas border.

* 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 20 to 30 mph with gusts to
around 40 mph.

* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 8 to 12 percent.

* IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
Outdoor burning is not recommended.
properties.instruction:
Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the
field of this Red Flag Warning.

NWSheadline: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING
